info.game_comments: (Sarah: In a few minutes, we'll be on the town in Chicago -- stay tuned!)

(1, 1).clue: It's the year JFK was sworn in as president

(2, 1).clue: It's what Murray Langston wore to turn himself into the Gong Show's Unknown Comic
(2, 1).correct response: a paper bag over his head

(3, 1).clue: It's what a gosling grows up to be

(4, 1).clue: This Van Damme film shares its name with an overtime period of play added to a tied hockey game

(5, 1).clue: Go against your best interest & you shoot yourself here

(6, 1).clue: The name of this potent potable of bourbon & mint comes from an Arabic word meaning "rose water"

(1, 2).clue: Of 1988, 1990 or 1994, the year of East & West Germany's reunification

(2, 2).clue: The test named for this chemical paper has one decisive factor

(5, 2).clue: A quick & reckless reaction has you shooting from this body part

(6, 2).clue: This Scottish poet's love was "like a red, red rose"

(2, 3).clue: Instrument name of the paper fold seen here

(5, 4).clue: When you brag or boast, you shoot off this body part

(6, 4).clue: This conflict's last battle in 1485 resulted in the house of Lancaster taking power in England

(1, 5).clue: Beginning a long dry decade, the Prohibition amendment took effect in this year

(3, 5).clue: Darwin is noted for his study of this bird in the Galapagos Islands

(5, 5).correct response: when you see the whites of their eyes

(6, 5).clue: In this film, Woody Allen is a manager to blind xylophonists, piano-playing birds & has-been crooners

(1, 1).clue: Though it seats 500, Gino's East regularly has lines outside for this culinary specialty, even in winter

(2, 1).clue: Fagin & the gang stop picking people's pockets & drop money in instead; what a "Twist"!

(3, 1).clue: 2 of his many books are "The Foot Book" & "The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins"

(4, 1).clue: Born in Missouri in 1884, according to his names, he was "Head of the House" & "A Faithful Man"

(5, 1).clue: Appropriately, you'll find an Old West museum bearing his name in Cody, Wyoming

(6, 1).clue: A card game named for a middle-aged unmarried woman

(3, 2).clue: Astrid Lindgren, who died in 2002 at age 94, first spun tales about this freckled girl for her daughter

(4, 2).clue: The first & last names of this president born in 1809 mean "Father of Many Nations" & "Of the Lake Colony"

(5, 2).clue: They're the pioneering rockers heard hereSee ya' later alligator...

(6, 2).clue: From the team's avian nickname, Bill Mlkvy was this "without a vowel" when he played basketball for Temple

(2, 3).clue: Ms. Oakley gives up her rifle & becomes an anti-gun activist (Charlton Heston hates the new show)

(6, 3).clue: Christian monks take vows of poverty, chastity & this

(6, 4).clue: Sleipnir was the magical steed ridden by this Norse god

(2, 5).clue: Domestic abuser Billy Bigelow reforms & builds a family therapy theme park around that merry-go-round

(6, 5).clue: A liquid hydrocarbon formula C8H18, found in petroleum
